availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Albert Engelhard (Jefferson County, KY, flour dealer & wholesale grocer)

body.p: Jefferson County, Kentucky, flour dealer and wholesale grocer. Native of Waldenhof, Germany (Prussia). Married to Augusta Julia Stein Engelhard on December 11, 1856. Father of Augusta Engelhard, Berthina Engelhard, George Engelhard, and Victor Engelhard. Wholesale grocer in Louisville in 1859. Flour dealer in Jefferson County in 1861.

ab.bibl:
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Jefferson County, Louisville Ward 4, p. 419B.
Kentucky Birth, Marriage and Death Records – Microfilm (1852-1910), KDLA, Rolls ##994027-994058, Jefferson County Marriages, p. 25 of microfilm.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Jefferson County Marriages, Film #000482708, p. 444 of microfilm.
_Passport Applications, 1890-1892. NARA, Washington D.C.; Roll #365 - 17 Mar 1891-31 Mar 1891, p.318 of microfilm.
Henry Tanner, ed., The Louisville Directory and Business Advertiser for 1859-60 (Louisville: Maxwell & Co., 1859), 75 and 284.
KYR-0001-017-0163.
Birth and Death Records: Covington, Lexington, Louisville, and Newport – Microfilm (before 1911), KDLA, Roll #7007128, Louisville Deaths, Books 7-8, 1887-1894, p. 775 of microfilm.
Find A Grave, "Albert Engelhard (1825-1894)," Memorial 120204255, https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/120204255 (accessed January 21, 2020).
